description.narrative: Output 1.5. By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to sustainably increase access to and use of quality/safe drinking water, improved sanitation and positive hygiene practices in rural and poor urban households and communities, as well as institutions, in both development and humanitarian situations

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5. By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to sustainably increase access to and use of quality/safe drinking water, improved sanitation and positive hygiene practices in rural and poor urban households and communities, as well as institutions, in both development and humanitarian situations
